result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey J Trzebiatowski

records.addlTxt: /s/ PB 11/03/22 - The Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14(1r)(c) finds it contains probable cause.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services filed by Atty Travis Slattery (sent to Br 3 Judge on 11/02/22 sp)
Competency hearing on January 17, 2023 at 01:00 pm.

1:40 PM Defendant Jeffrey J Trzebiatowski in court.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Jeffrey J Trzebiatowski.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Atty Slattery requests a competency evaluation.

Atty Slattery will prepare the order for the Court to sign.

Parties to talk with judicial assistant to set next court date. 

BY THE COURT:
Court orders evaluation, outpatient evaluation, to be submitted by Atty Slattery in a word format.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 10/31/22 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 1

Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney /s/ PB 10/12/22
Atty Travis Slattery appointed
Repayment of Attorney Fees @ $50/month
First payment to commence on 11/01/22

Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency 
Current Employer Information 
Wisconsin State Public Defender Eligibility Evaluation Form
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
No contact with the BP in Amherst
No contact with R.D.
Take all medications as prescribed and participate in any treatment he may be currently be prescribed

1:05 PM Defendant Jeffrey Trzebiatowski appeared by video, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA)  Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.

Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct and Stalking.
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Public defender representation - more verification is needed for the State Public Defender to determine if he is eligible.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Court questions ADA Dodge with regards to the amount of times the defendant had been to the BP and asked to leave.
ADA Dodge responds.

Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record. 
State has complied with victim rights notification.
No victim appears in court today.
Court will set a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.

1:18 p.m.  Sister of the Defendant makes a statement to the Court.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
